subject: Re: [junit] Understanding Fixtures
msgSnippet: So said  Jonathan Hecht  on  2002-12-17 -------------------- ... This is a new local variable named word . You want to assign to the already-declared field
messageBody:
So said Jonathan Hecht on 2002-12-17 --------------------

>I do not think I understand how to use fixtures. I have looked at the

>FAQ and junit documentation on line and it is not helping me with my
>problem.

>import junit.framework.*;
>public class ProgramTest extends junit.framework.TestCase {
> private MyProgram word;
> private MyProgram game;
> private MyProgram anotherWord;
>
> protected void setUp() {
> // if this code is put under each individual test method, it runs
>correctly
>
> MyProgram word = new MyProgram("Word", MyProgram.WORDPROCESSOR);

This is a new local variable named "word". You want to assign to the
already-declared field "word".

I do this from time to time. Try this:

word = new MyProgram("Word", MyProgram.WORDPROCESSOR);

and do the same for the others.

Sometimes you just need another pair of eyes... :)

J. B. Rainsberger,
